page.title: 13The Old Brickyard-Kinoulton
page.content: During the{Public Inquiry}in May, 1985 into Coal-Mining under Kinoulton, many people learned for the first time about a{"Site of Special Scientific {Interest"}in Kinoulton. Most villagers knew of the{Old Brickyard}near the canal to the S.E.of the bridge, but did not realise its importance. The area was made a S.S.S.I. in 1983 because it included some of the richest marsh and open water habitats in Nottinghamshire. The site has three parts-grassland, grazed marsh and open water and there are suitable feeding and breeding conditions for a wide range of birds. Many unusual plants and flowers have grown there undisturbed for many years. There is concern that if mining took place under that area, land drainage would change and alter the conditions.
